result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Douglas Collier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage)

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 9/1/2022.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court set restitution at $1,250.00 payable to C.W.

Complete a course in anger management.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

No contact with C.W. which rises to the level of probable cause for arrest for domestic abuse or harassment. Third party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek Douglas Collier

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek Douglas Collier appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Derek Douglas Collier.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Count 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel as to sentencing.

As to Count 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with Huber release for work, with credit for 5 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Court set restitution at $ 1,250.00 payable to C.W.
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with C.W., which rises to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment". 
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children (as approved by agent). 
- No contact with firearms.
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.


*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 09/01/2022.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Case set for a final pre-trial on 7/29/22 at 8:30 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Plea and sentencing hearing set for 8/30/22 at 9:30 am. Jury trial date is cancelled. Parties notified via email.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Derek Douglas Collier in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Foley J. Van Lieshout appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with KC and CW
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Derek Douglas Collier in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Derek Douglas Collier in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek Douglas Collier appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
